intro: Entandrophragma choriandrum, commonly known as the African teak, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody pods containing flat, oval seeds. It is valued for its durable, heavy timber used in furniture and construction. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitats.
